entry.title: Russia Launches Fresh Missile Strikes, Widening Attacks on Ukrainian Power Plants
entry.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Russia has destroyed about 30% of the country’s power stations as Moscow tries to sap Ukraine’s will and ability to fight on the battlefield following a month of gains by Kyiv.

entry.title: War Drives a Rift Between Two Ukrainian Brothers
entry.content: Russia and Ukraine have historical and cultural ties stretching back centuries, and some 20 million Ukrainians have relatives in Russia. Clashing experiences of the war have created gulfs among many of them.

entry.title: Xi Jinping's Ideological Ambition Challenges China's Economic Prospects
entry.content: Many economists predict slower growth, in part due to Xi’s focus on Communist Party control. He shows few signs of changing course on his priorities.
